New Records: Freddie Freeman hit four homers and drove in 12 runs across the five games, winning World Series MVP.
Freddie Freeman extended his historic World Series home run streak to six games, tying the record for the most homers by a player in a single World Series.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers rallied from a 5-0 deficit to win 7-6 in Game 5.
The Dodgers scored five runs in the fifth inning, all of which came in the wake of three fielding miscues by the Yankees.
Aaron Judge made a jumping catch while colliding with the wall to rob Freddie Freeman of a home run.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a solo shot off Ryan Brasier, leading off the bottom of the third with a solo shot.
Aaron Judge launched a two-run homer to right field, his first home run of the World Series.
Mookie Betts hit an RBI single, Freddie Freeman hit a two-run single with the bases loaded, and then Teoscar Hern√°ndez hit a two-run double to tie the game at 5.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were heavily favored to win the series, with odds (-800) to win the World Series by 60%.
The Yankees' odds (+550) to win it all improved by 45% after the loss in Game 4.
Anthony Rizzo, who was on the 2016 Chicago Cubs which came back from 3-1 to win the World Series, said winning the first game after going down 3-0 was the hardest one.
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The Dodgers' manager, Dave Roberts, said the team has 'zero quit in it' and that they'still got innings' to play.
The Yankees' manager was not quoted in the article, but the team's fans were disappointed after the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was watched by 13.64 million viewers on Fox, Fox Deportes, and streaming, beating 'Monday Night Football' in the battle for television viewers.
The Yankees redistributed the ejected fans' tickets to a pediatric cancer patient and his family.
Shohei Ohtani stoked national pride in Japan with his World Series debut.
Mookie Betts had a crazy moment with Yankees fans in Game 4, with two fans crossing into the field of play and interfering with him.
